alert.note: Alert for Barnstable; Dukes; Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Nantucket; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 3:37PM EST until January 30 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SATURDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (3.3 to 13.7 feet Mean Lower Low Water). * WHERE...Eastern MA coast including Cape Cod and the Islands. * WHEN...Saturday morning and evening high tide cycles. * IMPACTS...Coastal flooding is expected along the North Shore from Gloucester to Newburyport. Wave action will likely cause some washover onto coastal roads around the time of high tide. Minor coastal flooding begins on Easy Street in Nantucket. Expect minor coastal flooding of some low-lying roadways. Minor coastal flooding occurs in Provincetown, in the vicinity of Race Point Road and Provincetown Airport. In Truro backwater flooding occurs along the Pamet River. Minor coastal flooding occurs along Morrissey Boulevard in Boston. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
